page.title: 09RELIGION IN THE BRAES
page.content: Not so many years ago, almost all the people in the Braes were Roman Catholics. A beautiful church called 'Our Lady Of Perpetual Succour' was built by the Abbe Macpherson who had studied for the Priesthood at the Scalan. He also built the school alongside the chapel. The inside of the chapel is beautiful and has the words of the 'Our Father' in latin painted round the ceiling. With the shortage of priests and the decline of numbers in the parish, it was decided to amalgamate with the parishes of Tombae and Tomintoul, with the priest staying in Tomintoul. With the influx of people to operate the distillery, other denominations are now represented. Presbyterians can attend services at Tomintoul or Achbreck but Episcopalians must travel to Aberlour or Dufftown.
